content.text: To find the area of a compound figure, you can follow these steps:
1. Break the compound figure into basic shapes, such as rectangles and triangles.
2. Find the area of each basic shape.

attrs.svgContent:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 240 300" preserveAspectRatio="xMidYMid meet" style="width:100%;height:auto;display:block;">
  <g id="lines" stroke="black" stroke-width="2" fill="none">
    <line x1="60" y1="40" x2="200" y2="40" />
    <line x1="200" y1="40" x2="200" y2="240" />
    <line x1="200" y1="240" x2="60" y2="240" />
    <line x1="60" y1="240" x2="60" y2="40" />
  </g>

  <!-- Label backgrounds (white boxes so text is always visible) -->
  <g id="label_backgrounds" fill="white" stroke="none">
    <rect x="94" y="48" width="72" height="22" rx="4" ry="4" />
    <rect x="20" y="128" width="22" height="72" rx="4" ry="4" />
  </g>

  <g id="labels" fill="black" font-size="18" font-weight="700">
    <!-- 35 in: moved INSIDE and centered -->
    <text x="130" y="65" text-anchor="middle">35 in</text>

    <!-- 50 in: moved INSIDE left side, rotated around its center -->
    <text x="31" y="164" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(-90 31 164)">50 in</text>
  </g>
</svg>
attrs.title: Simple Rectangle
summary: The image shows a simple rectangle with horizontal and vertical sides.
short_desc: Rectangle with dimensions 35 in by 50 in.
long_desc: The image shows a simple rectangle. The top edge is labeled 35 inches, and the left edge is labeled 50 inches. There are no diagonal or angled edges.

alt: The image shows a decorative illustration of butterflies.
short_desc: The image is a colorful illustration of butterflies with a line drawing style.
long_desc: The image is a decorative illustration of butterflies. The butterflies are drawn with black outlines and filled with purple color. The background is white.
attrs.title: Butterfly Illustration
